SENT.plain: A neonate presented with cloverleaf skull anomaly and severe proptosis requiring urgent cranioplasty to attain eyelid closure
Despite this, she experienced exposure keratitis and corneal perforations
A ventriculoperitoneal shunt was performed subsequently to relieve hydrocephalus, but respiratory problems eventually led to her death at 6 months
This case highlights the complexity of the problems encountered in the cloverleaf skull anomaly, and a brief review discussing its management is included
Despite improvements in treatment of this condition, the overall prognosis remains poor
